intro: Landolphia dubia, commonly known as the African horned vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive, showy flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that are often clustered in terminal panicles. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Landolphia dubia is often found in moist, forested areas and can grow as a climbing or trailing vine.
